taskDescription:
The number of unread emails in Bryanâ€™s account is 100. This number grows by 15 unread emails a day. The function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>N</mi>
  <mrow>
    <mo>(</mo>
    <mi>t</mi>
    <mo>)</mo>
  </mrow>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>100</mn>
  <mo>+</mo>
  <mn>15</mn>
  <mi>t</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">N\left( t \right) = 100 + 15t</annotation></semantics></math> represents the relation between the number of emails, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>N</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">N</annotation></semantics></math>, and the time, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>t</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">t</annotation></semantics></math>, measured in days. Find <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>N</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">N</annotation></semantics></math>(7). Explain what the result means.
